column4: ANyone with any solns for this problem.. Google's been a bitch so far...I tried to boot up.. getting this error /* Kernel panic - not syncing:VFS: Unable to mount fs on unknown-block(0,0)*/
ANyone with any solns for this problem.. Google's been a bitch so far...I tried to boot up.. getting this error /* Kernel panic - not syncing:VFS: Unable to mount fs on unknown-block(0,0)*/
what are you trying to do?
I tried to boot up... but I have been geeting this error   /* Kernel panic - not syncing:VFS: Unable to mount fs on unknown-block(0,0)*/
you have remote drive added to mount on boot?
no, its is just local drive on a laptop
why is it VFS complaining then?
I am not sure... Any idears to fix it
fsck could do something about it... but make sure partition is not mounted since if will make problems
Heh, I run sudo fsck.ext4 -v /dev/xxx . But I got this..., /dev/sda7:clean, 177507/2564096 files, xxxx/xxxxx blocks
Anything else, I shld have done different
U still there, Dont tell me.. you have also abandoned me like the others...
am still here, just don't have a smart solution, is that system still usable?
Yeah, i can log into the windows vista portion
my suggestion would be to get some software for partition editing... like gparted or partition magic and see if that partition is still alive...
if partition works, then maybe the problem is with configuration, otherwise, problem is with partition and data could be potentialy lost
THe partition seems to be there.. i can mount it via LiveCD
can you paste me your /etc/fstab ?!
where is the /etc/fstab.. Cos I am in LiveCD now...
on your root partition
I just ran sudo e2fsck -b blockNum /dev/sda7
I don't know what that command does
I read this here...http://linuxexpresso.wordpress.com/2010/03/31/repair-a-broken-ext4-superblock-in-ubuntu/
